intro: Lastrea teuscheri, commonly known as the Teuscher's lastrea, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and high sunlight exposure. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by succulent enthusiasts.
